summary: The concept of "ocean energy," categorized under soft energy, is redirected to the preferred term "marine energy" within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. Marine energy encompasses various renewable energy sources derived from oceanic phenomena, including tidal, wave, and thermal energy. The European Union actively promotes marine energy as part of its commitment to sustainable energy transition and climate change mitigation. Regulatory initiatives aim to facilitate the development and integration of marine energy technologies into the energy market, ensuring compliance with environmental standards and fostering innovation. This strategic focus aligns with the EU's broader objectives of enhancing energy security and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
